author: Eric Alperin
description: Some like to muddle a bitters-soaked brown sugar cube until "smooth paste" to make this cocktail. Depending on your sugar cube, even with a splash of soda water, after what seems like an eternity you may still see sugar crystals rather than paste. Life's too short so I've used 2:1 brown sugar syrup to make this punchy nightcap of a cocktail. One man's paste is another man's syrup!
name: Colonial Ties
recipeIngredient: 7.5 ml Demerara/Muscovado/brown sugar syrup (2 sugar:1 water)
30 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof / 50% alc./vol.)
10 ml Chilled water (omit if wet ice)

recipeInstructions.text: RINSE (coat inside) chilled glass with absinthe and set aside
Add other ingredients to mixing glass, STIR with ice and strain into absinthe-rinsed glass (Sazerac-style, without ice in glass)
